data:
1
00:00:00,041 --> 00:00:03,128
25.000

2
00:01:52,112 --> 00:01:53,947
Bingo!

3
00:02:08,253 --> 00:02:10,130
Fucking hell.

4
00:02:12,382 --> 00:02:14,342
Fucking hell.

5
00:03:04,476 --> 00:03:07,145
- Oh, God...
- Keep your shit together.

6
00:03:07,228 --> 00:03:10,315
If you wanna get 'em out of here.

7
00:03:11,149 --> 00:03:13,818
- I can pop these, no problem.
- So get to it!

8
00:03:28,041 --> 00:03:30,543
Security, we have a break-in. Get the...

9
00:03:39,010 --> 00:03:41,846
I know who you are.
I know what you think...

10
00:03:41,930 --> 00:03:45,767
If you don't wanna get hurt,
keep your mouth shut and don't move.

11
00:03:45,850 --> 00:03:51,106
The chimps are infected. They're highly
contagious. They've been given an inhibitor.

12
00:03:51,189 --> 00:03:54,651
- lnfected with what?
- To cure, you must first understand.

13
00:03:54,734 --> 00:03:57,696
Infected with what?

14
00:03:59,656 --> 00:04:01,533
Rage.

15
00:04:03,243 --> 00:04:06,413
- What is he talking about?
- Get the cages open.

16
00:04:06,496 --> 00:04:07,831
No! No! No!

17
00:04:08,540 --> 00:04:12,836
Listen, you sick bastard,
we're taking your torture victims with us.

18
00:04:12,919 --> 00:04:14,504
We'll get you out of here.

19
00:04:14,587 --> 00:04:19,259
The animals are contagious. The infection
is in their blood and saliva. One bite...

20
00:04:19,342 --> 00:04:21,845
Stop... Stop! You've no idea!

21
00:04:28,393 --> 00:04:31,229
Get it off! Help me!

22
00:04:36,609 --> 00:04:38,737
Get it off! Get it off!

23
00:04:42,365 --> 00:04:45,577
- What's the matter with her?
- You have to kill her!

24
00:04:47,662 --> 00:04:49,914
Oh, my God!

25
00:04:54,252 --> 00:04:57,464
- What's the matter with her?
- We have to kill her now!

26
00:04:59,966 --> 00:05:01,551
Oh, God...

27
00:06:50,535 --> 00:06:52,037
Hello?

28
00:07:30,492 --> 00:07:31,993
Hello?

29
00:07:50,136 --> 00:07:52,138
Hello!

30
00:09:34,074 --> 00:09:35,408
Hello?

31
00:10:01,726 --> 00:10:03,228
Hello!

32
00:14:55,562 --> 00:14:57,647
Hello?

33
00:15:05,655 --> 00:15:07,741
Hello?

34
00:15:22,088 --> 00:15:24,174
Father?

35
00:15:30,597 --> 00:15:32,682
Father, are you OK?

36
00:15:40,023 --> 00:15:42,692
Oh, shouldn't have done that.

37
00:15:43,109 --> 00:15:45,362
Shouldn't have done that.

38
00:15:45,779 --> 00:15:47,655
Shit!

39
00:16:14,432 --> 00:16:16,559
Over here!

40
00:16:19,437 --> 00:16:21,773
- Over here!
- Come on!

41
00:16:34,244 --> 00:16:36,705
Go, go, go!

42
00:16:41,960 --> 00:16:43,044
Keep going!

43
00:16:43,128 --> 00:16:46,006
- What the fuck is going on?
- Just shut up!

44
00:16:54,139 --> 00:16:56,725
- Covered everything.
- Who are those people?

45
00:17:24,044 --> 00:17:25,295
Let's go! Let's go!

46
00:17:25,378 --> 00:17:27,630
- What the fuck is going on?
- Just move!

47
00:17:36,431 --> 00:17:38,433
Come on!

48
00:17:57,619 --> 00:18:02,374
Man walks into a bar with a giraffe.
They each get pissed.

49
00:18:02,457 --> 00:18:04,459
The giraffe falls over.

50
00:18:04,542 --> 00:18:09,756
The man goes to leave and the barman says
''Oi! You can't leave that lying there.''

51
00:18:09,839 --> 00:18:13,885
He says ''No, it's not a lion. It's a giraffe''.

52
00:18:21,518 --> 00:18:24,396
He's completely humourless.

53
00:18:24,479 --> 00:18:27,399
You two should get on like a house on fire.

54
00:18:28,900 --> 00:18:30,985
So who are you?

55
00:18:32,195 --> 00:18:34,114
You're from the hospital.

56
00:18:34,197 --> 00:18:37,701
- Are you a doctor?
- He's not a doctor. He's a patient.

57
00:18:37,784 --> 00:18:40,120
I'm a bicycle courier.

58
00:18:42,288 --> 00:18:48,712
I was riding a package from Farringdon to
Shaftesbury Avenue and a car cut across me.

59
00:18:48,795 --> 00:18:52,549
Then I wake up today in hospital.
I wake up and I'm...

60
00:18:52,632 --> 00:18:54,551
I'm hallucinating or I'm...

61
00:18:56,219 --> 00:18:58,680
What's your name?

62
00:18:58,763 --> 00:19:00,849
Jim.

63
00:19:01,516 --> 00:19:04,185
I'm Mark. This is Selena.

64
00:19:08,606 --> 00:19:10,275
OK, Jim.

65
00:19:15,488 --> 00:19:18,033
I've got some bad news.

66
00:19:18,116 --> 00:19:24,372
It started as rioting, and right from
the beginning you knew this was different.

67
00:19:24,456 --> 00:19:28,626
Because it was happening
in small villages, market towns.

68
00:19:29,502 --> 00:19:32,255
And then it wasn't on the TV any more.

69
00:19:32,339 --> 00:19:37,052
It was in the street outside.
It was coming through your windows.

70
00:19:37,135 --> 00:19:38,970
It was a virus.

71
00:19:39,054 --> 00:19:40,847
An infection.

72
00:19:40,930 --> 00:19:43,767
You didn't need a doctor to tell you that.

73
00:19:43,850 --> 00:19:46,311
It was the blood.

74
00:19:46,394 --> 00:19:48,897
There was something in the blood.

75
00:19:50,357 --> 00:19:55,320
By the time they tried to evacuate
the cities, it was already too late.

76
00:19:55,403 --> 00:19:58,323
The infection was everywhere.

77
00:19:58,406 --> 00:20:00,909
The army blockades were overrun.

78
00:20:02,452 --> 00:20:05,163
And that's when the exodus started.

79
00:20:06,539 --> 00:20:09,292
The day before broadcasting stopped,

80
00:20:09,376 --> 00:20:13,046
there were reports of lnfection
in Paris and New York.

81
00:20:15,423 --> 00:20:18,343
We didn't hear anything more after that.

82
00:20:21,304 --> 00:20:24,265
- What's the government doing?
- There's no government.

83
00:20:24,349 --> 00:20:26,810
Of course there's a government!

84
00:20:26,893 --> 00:20:30,980
There's always a government.
They're in a bunker or a plane...

85
00:20:31,064 --> 00:20:35,360
No, there's no government,
no police, no army.

86
00:20:36,820 --> 00:20:39,906
No TV, no radio, no electricity.

87
00:20:40,532 --> 00:20:44,703
You're the first uninfected person
we've seen in six days.

88
00:20:45,537 --> 00:20:47,622
Where's your family?

89
00:20:48,540 --> 00:20:50,583
They're dead. Like Selena's.

90
00:20:50,667 --> 00:20:52,794
Yours will be dead too.

91
00:21:03,096 --> 00:21:07,100
Look, I have to find them.
They live in Deptford. I can walk it. OK?

92
00:21:07,183 --> 00:21:09,769
You'll go and come back, yeah?

93
00:21:11,730 --> 00:21:13,982
- You won't.
- Yes!

94
00:21:14,065 --> 00:21:17,068
No one ever comes back.

95
00:21:21,573 --> 00:21:23,658
So lesson one.

96
00:21:24,534 --> 00:21:28,955
You never go anywhere alone
unless you've got no choice.

97
00:21:29,039 --> 00:21:31,374
Lesson two.

98
00:21:31,458 --> 00:21:35,545
Only travel during daylight.
Unless you've got no choice.

99
00:21:37,589 --> 00:21:39,632
We'll take you tomorrow.

100
00:21:39,716 --> 00:21:43,303
We'll all go and find
your dead parents together, OK?

101
00:21:44,346 --> 00:21:45,805
Eat.

102
00:21:57,984 --> 00:22:01,154
If you want her to slow down,
you'll have to say.

103
00:22:28,056 --> 00:22:29,724
- If there's anyone...
- I understand.

104
00:22:29,808 --> 00:22:31,893
- Anyone...
- I understand!

105
00:22:34,020 --> 00:22:35,563
OK.

106
00:23:17,355 --> 00:23:18,690
Jim...

107
00:23:19,524 --> 00:23:20,859
Wait!

108
00:24:45,527 --> 00:24:49,489
They died peacefully.
You should be grateful.

109
00:24:49,572 --> 00:24:51,991
I'm not grateful.

110
00:24:53,243 --> 00:24:55,245
My...

111
00:24:55,954 --> 00:25:00,458
parents and my sister,
we went to Paddington Station,

112
00:25:03,086 --> 00:25:08,425
hoping maybe we could get on a plane,
maybe we could buy our way onto a plane.

113
00:25:09,050 --> 00:25:11,428
I remember my dad had all this cash,

114
00:25:11,511 --> 00:25:14,848
even though cash was completely useless.

115
00:25:16,391 --> 00:25:19,519
About 20,000 other people had the same idea.

116
00:25:22,022 --> 00:25:24,232
Crowd was surging.

117
00:25:25,066 --> 00:25:27,402
I lost my grip on my sister's hand.

118
00:25:29,571 --> 00:25:31,906
I remember the ground was soft.

119
00:25:33,867 --> 00:25:38,246
I looked down
and I was standing on all these people.

120
00:25:38,329 --> 00:25:42,292
Like a carpet. People who had fallen and...

121
00:25:42,375 --> 00:25:46,338
Somewhere in the crowd
there were lnfected. It spread fast.

122
00:25:46,421 --> 00:25:49,758
No one could run.
All you could do was climb.

123
00:25:51,384 --> 00:25:54,471
Climb over more people.
So I did that. I climbed.

124
00:25:54,554 --> 00:25:56,931
And I got up on top of this kiosk.

125
00:25:59,225 --> 00:26:04,189
Looking down, you couldn't tell
which faces were infected and which weren't.

126
00:26:04,272 --> 00:26:08,151
Then I saw my dad.
Not my mum or my sister.

127
00:26:08,234 --> 00:26:10,195
My dad.

128
00:26:12,489 --> 00:26:14,574
His face...

129
00:26:18,244 --> 00:26:22,165
Selena's right.
You should be grateful.

130
00:26:22,248 --> 00:26:27,420
We don't have time to get back to the shop
before dark. We should stay here tonight.

131
00:26:30,090 --> 00:26:32,926
My room's up at the top.
You two can have that.

132
00:26:33,009 --> 00:26:36,346
No, we'll all sleep in the same room. It's safer.

133
00:27:56,634 --> 00:27:58,720
Jim.

134
00:28:07,395 --> 00:28:09,481
- You're back.
- Yeah.

135
00:28:15,862 --> 00:28:17,947
- How was it?
- Fine.

136
00:28:19,032 --> 00:28:21,326
Give me a drink of that, will ya?

137
00:28:21,409 --> 00:28:23,495
- It's empty.
- Ha!

138
00:28:25,789 --> 00:28:28,124
Here.

139
00:28:30,210 --> 00:28:32,295
I'll start working on them, then.

140
00:28:38,927 --> 00:28:40,929
Mark! Mark!

141
00:28:41,721 --> 00:28:43,848
Selena! Help!

142
00:28:58,196 --> 00:29:00,281
It's clear.

143
00:29:05,745 --> 00:29:08,707
- That's Mr Bridges.
- Were you bitten?

144
00:29:08,790 --> 00:29:11,001
And his daughter. From four doors down.

145
00:29:11,084 --> 00:29:14,170
- Were you bitten?
- No.

146
00:29:14,254 --> 00:29:17,173
Did any of the blood get in your mouth?

147
00:29:18,091 --> 00:29:20,093
No.

148
00:29:23,221 --> 00:29:24,973
Mark?

149
00:29:27,392 --> 00:29:29,102
Wait...

150
00:29:50,957 --> 00:29:53,168
Get that cleaned off.

151
00:29:55,045 --> 00:29:57,130
Do you have any clothes here?

152
00:29:58,256 --> 00:30:00,133
Um... I... Yes.

153
00:30:00,216 --> 00:30:03,887
Then get them and get dressed.
We have to leave now.

154
00:30:03,970 --> 00:30:07,640
More lnfected will be coming.
They always do.

155
00:30:36,419 --> 00:30:39,422
How did you know?
How did you know he was infected?

156
00:30:39,506 --> 00:30:43,426
- The blood.
- There was blood on me. It was on you.

157
00:30:43,510 --> 00:30:48,890
I didn't know he was infected.
He knew. I could see it in his face.

158
00:30:48,973 --> 00:30:53,395
If someone gets infected,
you've about 20 seconds to kill them.

159
00:30:53,478 --> 00:30:58,608
It might be your brother, your sister
or your oldest friend. It makes no difference.

160
00:30:58,692 --> 00:31:04,114
Just so you know where you stand,
if it happens to you, I'll do it in a heartbeat.

161
00:31:04,197 --> 00:31:08,410
He was full of plans.
Have you got any plans, Jim?

162
00:31:08,493 --> 00:31:12,956
Do you want us to find a cure and
save the world orjust fall in love and fuck?

163
00:31:13,039 --> 00:31:15,542
Plans are pointless.

164
00:31:15,625 --> 00:31:18,211
Staying alive's as good as it gets.

165
00:31:20,046 --> 00:31:21,464
Hey, hey, hey, hey.

166
00:31:21,548 --> 00:31:23,633
What's that?

167
00:31:29,723 --> 00:31:31,808
Let's go.

168
00:32:16,936 --> 00:32:20,065
What is it about tower blocks
and shopping trolleys?

169
00:32:20,148 --> 00:32:23,234
Stop talking. It's a long way up.

170
00:32:32,952 --> 00:32:35,288
Do you need a break?

171
00:32:36,498 --> 00:32:38,500
- You?
- No.

172
00:32:41,169 --> 00:32:43,254
Now I do need a break.

173
00:32:53,723 --> 00:32:55,558
What's up?

174
00:32:55,642 --> 00:32:57,644
Nothin'.

175
00:33:00,021 --> 00:33:01,356
I got a headache.

176
00:33:01,439 --> 00:33:02,941
- Bad?
- Pretty bad.

177
00:33:03,024 --> 00:33:08,321
- Why didn't you say something before?
- I didn't think you'd give a shit.

178
00:33:09,531 --> 00:33:13,785
You've got no fat on you
and all you've had to eat is sugar.

179
00:33:13,868 --> 00:33:15,995
So you're crashing.

180
00:33:16,079 --> 00:33:18,331
There isn't a lot we can do about that

181
00:33:18,415 --> 00:33:23,503
except pump you full of painkillers
and give you more sugar. As for sugar,

182
00:33:23,586 --> 00:33:25,880
Pepsi or Lilt?

183
00:33:27,132 --> 00:33:29,134
Do you have any Tango?

184
00:33:29,217 --> 00:33:32,262
Actually,
I did have a can of Tango somewhere.

185
00:33:33,471 --> 00:33:35,724
Quiet! That's an lnfected.

186
00:33:46,067 --> 00:33:47,902
Oh no, they're in. Move!

187
00:33:50,989 --> 00:33:53,533
Wait up, Selena!

188
00:33:54,451 --> 00:33:56,453
Wait for me, please!

189
00:33:56,536 --> 00:33:58,663
Please, Selena! Please!

190
00:33:58,747 --> 00:34:01,082
- Wait for me!
- Come on!

191
00:34:01,166 --> 00:34:03,168
- Run!
- Wait!

192
00:34:03,793 --> 00:34:06,504
Please! For fuck's sake!

193
00:34:07,088 --> 00:34:09,341
- Selena!{49176}{49257}Down the corridor. Flat 157. Move!

194
00:34:14,512 --> 00:34:16,598
Thank you. Thank you.

195
00:34:29,069 --> 00:34:31,112
Open the door!

196
00:34:36,701 --> 00:34:38,286
Open the door!

197
00:34:42,999 --> 00:34:45,502
- Open up!
- Where's Dad?

198
00:34:45,585 --> 00:34:47,045
What?

199
00:34:49,631 --> 00:34:52,634
- Open the fucking door!
- Where's Dad?

200
00:34:52,717 --> 00:34:55,011
Let them in, Hannah. Let them inside.

201
00:35:02,936 --> 00:35:05,230
Go in. Go in!

202
00:35:23,248 --> 00:35:25,709
So, I'm Frank, anyway.

203
00:35:25,792 --> 00:35:27,585
Jim.

204
00:35:28,420 --> 00:35:31,506
- Selena.
- Selena. Good to meet you.

205
00:35:31,589 --> 00:35:33,883
This is my daughter Hannah.

206
00:35:33,967 --> 00:35:36,219
Come on, sweetheart. Say hello.

207
00:35:37,637 --> 00:35:39,723
Come on.

208
00:35:40,473 --> 00:35:42,434
So...

209
00:35:42,517 --> 00:35:44,436
This is great. Just great.

210
00:35:46,771 --> 00:35:49,065
Calls for a celebration, I'd say.

211
00:35:49,149 --> 00:35:52,193
Why don't you all sit down and...

212
00:35:52,277 --> 00:35:55,238
Hannah, what have we got to offer?

213
00:35:55,321 --> 00:35:57,824
We've got Mum's creme de menthe.

214
00:35:57,907 --> 00:36:00,618
Great. Creme de menthe.

215
00:36:00,702 --> 00:36:03,413
Oh, yeah. Look, sit, please.

216
00:36:03,496 --> 00:36:05,957
Get comfortable.

217
00:36:08,793 --> 00:36:11,796
- Where are the bloody glasses?
- Middle cupboard.

218
00:36:11,880 --> 00:36:14,758
Nah, the good ones. It's a celebration.

219
00:36:14,841 --> 00:36:17,344
Top cupboard.

220
00:36:17,427 --> 00:36:20,138
So this is your place?

221
00:36:21,389 --> 00:36:23,141
It's nice.

222
00:36:36,321 --> 00:36:37,447
There.

223
00:36:37,530 --> 00:36:40,617
I know it isn't much but, well, cheers.

224
00:36:40,700 --> 00:36:42,452
Cheers.

225
00:37:03,973 --> 00:37:06,059
You OK in there, Jim?

226
00:37:07,018 --> 00:37:09,354
Yeah.

227
00:37:09,437 --> 00:37:15,026
Sorry we couldn't spare the water.
Same with the toilet. The flush doesn't work.

228
00:37:16,695 --> 00:37:18,947
You'll have to use the bucket.

229
00:37:25,495 --> 00:37:28,123
Have to empty it each morning.

230
00:37:28,206 --> 00:37:31,876
Just chuck it over the balcony.
No mod cons here.

231
00:37:31,960 --> 00:37:33,670
It's fine.

232
00:37:33,753 --> 00:37:36,881
Listen, it's late. We're gonna turn in.

233
00:37:38,550 --> 00:37:40,927
We have a spare room.

234
00:37:41,970 --> 00:37:43,263
In there.

235
00:37:43,346 --> 00:37:45,306
Are you and Selena...?

236
00:37:46,558 --> 00:37:48,393
No. No, no, no.

237
00:37:48,476 --> 00:37:50,145
Um...

238
00:37:50,228 --> 00:37:52,605
I'll take the living room. It's fine.

239
00:37:52,689 --> 00:37:54,566
Right.

240
00:37:55,442 --> 00:37:57,527
No, I mean, yeah.

241
00:37:58,570 --> 00:38:00,572
So, um...

242
00:38:01,614 --> 00:38:04,617
- Goodnight, then.
- Yeah. Goodnight, Frank.

243
00:38:19,257 --> 00:38:20,800
Very spruce.

244
00:38:22,135 --> 00:38:24,971
- Very shredded.
- Yeah.

245
00:38:29,309 --> 00:38:33,021
- So what do you make of them?
- Well, they're desperate.

246
00:38:34,147 --> 00:38:36,983
Probably need us more than we need them.

247
00:38:38,443 --> 00:38:40,695
I think they're good people.

248
00:38:43,531 --> 00:38:46,493
- Good people?
- Yeah.

249
00:38:48,286 --> 00:38:52,957
You should be more concerned about
whether they're gonna slow you down.

250
00:38:53,041 --> 00:38:56,795
- Because if they slowed you down...
- I'd leave them behind.

251
00:38:56,878 --> 00:38:58,797
- In a heartbeat.
- Yeah.

252
00:38:59,506 --> 00:39:01,174
I wouldn't.

253
00:39:01,257 --> 00:39:04,803
Then you're gonna wind up
getting yourself killed.

254
00:39:13,144 --> 00:39:15,647
I'm gonna get some sleep.

255
00:39:18,149 --> 00:39:20,026
Selena...

256
00:39:20,860 --> 00:39:24,114
You think I don't get it, but I do get it.

257
00:39:25,990 --> 00:39:29,994
And I know I'd be dead already
if I hadn't met you.

258
00:39:30,495 --> 00:39:32,080
Sure.

259
00:39:32,163 --> 00:39:33,748
No, look...

260
00:39:36,126 --> 00:39:38,211
I mean, thank you.

261
00:39:41,381 --> 00:39:43,550
And I mean, sure.

262
00:39:43,633 --> 00:39:46,428
Goodnight, Jim.

263
00:39:46,511 --> 00:39:48,596
Goodnight.

264
00:40:02,193 --> 00:40:04,279
We lost water pressure three weeks ago.

265
00:40:04,362 --> 00:40:08,491
I thought we'd be OK with the water
from the other flats. Cisterns and tanks.

266
00:40:08,575 --> 00:40:11,786
But it vanishes so quick
you wouldn't believe.

267
00:40:15,081 --> 00:40:16,791
You drink it,

268
00:40:16,875 --> 00:40:18,668
it evaporates,

269
00:40:18,752 --> 00:40:20,837
turns stagnant.

270
00:40:23,214 --> 00:40:25,300
They're all empty.

271
00:40:26,176 --> 00:40:28,178
Hasn't rained in ten days.

272
00:40:28,261 --> 00:40:32,515
You can set up a plastic sheet
to catch dew and condensation.

273
00:40:32,599 --> 00:40:36,353
Saw it on TV once, but I can't make it work.

274
00:40:37,687 --> 00:40:39,773
You'd never think it.

275
00:40:40,690 --> 00:40:43,651
Needing rain so badly.

276
00:40:45,320 --> 00:40:47,739
Not in fucking England!

277
00:40:52,410 --> 00:40:55,538
Jim, we're not going to be able to stay here.

278
00:41:04,464 --> 00:41:08,218
- There's been no broadcasts for weeks.
- Just listen.

279
00:41:08,301 --> 00:41:12,889
Salvation is here.
The answer to lnfection is here.

280
00:41:12,972 --> 00:41:15,975
if you can hear this, you're not alone.

281
00:41:16,059 --> 00:41:20,563
There are others like you.
There are other survivors.

282
00:41:20,647 --> 00:41:22,857
We are soldiers and we are armed.

283
00:41:22,941 --> 00:41:26,236
Oh, my God. Soldiers.

284
00:41:26,319 --> 00:41:30,907
- Quiet. There's more.
- Our location is the 42nd blockade, M602,

285
00:41:30,990 --> 00:41:34,411
27 miles northeast of Manchester.

286
00:41:34,494 --> 00:41:38,415
- You must find us. Salvation is...
- Now itjust repeats.

287
00:41:38,498 --> 00:41:40,875
- It's a recording?
- Yeah, it's a recording.

288
00:41:40,959 --> 00:41:43,878
But this is where it's telling us to go.

289
00:41:43,962 --> 00:41:46,131
Just there.

290
00:41:47,632 --> 00:41:52,429
The way things are, we might need
two or three days to get up there.

291
00:41:52,512 --> 00:41:54,222
''We''?

292
00:41:58,309 --> 00:42:04,399
Sound carries in this flat. Me and Hannah
do need you more than you need us.

293
00:42:04,482 --> 00:42:07,652
- Look, I didn't...
- No, it's OK. It's the truth.

294
00:42:07,736 --> 00:42:10,238
I can't leave the block if it's the two of us.

295
00:42:10,321 --> 00:42:14,284
Something might happen to me.
Hannah'd be alone. I couldn't risk it.

296
00:42:14,367 --> 00:42:16,077
But with other people...

297
00:42:16,161 --> 00:42:20,457
If it's a recording,
the soldiers who made it could be dead.

298
00:42:20,540 --> 00:42:24,044
- It's possible.
- That stuff about the answer to lnfection...

299
00:42:24,127 --> 00:42:28,423
There is no answer!
It's already done all the damage it can!

300
00:42:28,506 --> 00:42:31,343
- Maybe they have a cure.
- Maybe they've got nothing.

301
00:42:31,426 --> 00:42:35,513
- The only way to find out is to reach them.
- We could die trying, Frank!

302
00:42:37,599 --> 00:42:39,893
Or die here.

303
00:42:39,976 --> 00:42:45,690
And anyway, it isn't true what Dad said.
You need us just the same as we need you.

304
00:42:47,192 --> 00:42:49,069
We need each other.

305
00:42:49,152 --> 00:42:54,449
And we'll never be safe in the cities.
The soldiers could keep us safe.

306
00:42:55,158 --> 00:42:57,243
So we have to try and get there.

307
00:42:58,370 --> 00:42:59,954
Get there how?

308
00:43:11,383 --> 00:43:15,136
Just so you know,
I don't take cheques or credit cards.

309
00:43:43,707 --> 00:43:46,710
- What do you think?
- It's the most direct route.

310
00:43:46,793 --> 00:43:52,048
Then we should take the indirect route.
The one in daylight and not underground.

311
00:43:52,132 --> 00:43:54,467
Let's just get it done.

312
00:44:07,397 --> 00:44:09,566
No, no.

313
00:44:09,649 --> 00:44:12,152
No. See, this is a really shit idea.

314
00:44:13,028 --> 00:44:16,406
You know why?
Because it's obviously a shit idea.

315
00:44:16,489 --> 00:44:20,869
So we're gonna drive into the tunnel
full of fucking smashed cars...

316
00:44:20,952 --> 00:44:23,872
It's really fucking obviously a shit idea!

317
00:44:23,955 --> 00:44:26,207
Hold on!

318
00:44:35,383 --> 00:44:37,260
Dad!

319
00:44:56,696 --> 00:44:58,239
Fuck!

320
00:44:59,532 --> 00:45:01,951
The world's worst place to get a flat.

321
00:45:02,035 --> 00:45:05,372
Agreed. I think we'd better do this quick.

322
00:45:07,874 --> 00:45:10,043
I've got the wheel. You're on the jack.

323
00:45:24,641 --> 00:45:28,186
Do you hear that?
Hey, hey, do you hear that?

324
00:45:28,269 --> 00:45:30,355
Hear what?

325
00:45:31,022 --> 00:45:33,316
Right, I've done it.

326
00:45:34,901 --> 00:45:36,361
Dad?

327
00:45:40,240 --> 00:45:43,326
- Jesus Christ!{65776}{65813}Fucking rats!

328
00:45:55,505 --> 00:45:58,091
They're running from the lnfected.

329
00:45:58,174 --> 00:46:00,093
Move it!

330
00:46:00,176 --> 00:46:04,472
Forget the jack, Hannah.
There's no time. Just lift, everyone.

331
00:46:04,556 --> 00:46:07,809
Grab hold! One, two, three, lift!

332
00:46:11,771 --> 00:46:13,732
Lift, lift!

333
00:46:14,274 --> 00:46:19,404
- Don't look at them! Don't look!
- I can see them! They're coming!

334
00:46:25,118 --> 00:46:27,704
Come on, Hannah!

335
00:46:27,787 --> 00:46:30,206
Almost.

336
00:46:30,290 --> 00:46:33,209
- Get the tyre on, Hannah!
- I'm trying.

337
00:46:38,006 --> 00:46:40,675
Three, two, one,

338
00:46:40,759 --> 00:46:42,469
drop it!

339
00:46:46,598 --> 00:46:49,059
- Get in the car!
- Come on!

340
00:46:51,144 --> 00:46:53,521
- Frank, drive!
- Move it, Frank!

341
00:46:56,441 --> 00:46:58,526
Whoo!

342
00:47:03,323 --> 00:47:05,408
Goodbye, you fuckers!

343
00:47:13,375 --> 00:47:15,669
Frank, stop the cab.

344
00:47:38,650 --> 00:47:40,944
Let's shop.

345
00:47:51,579 --> 00:47:53,081
You...

346
00:47:53,873 --> 00:47:55,375
You...

347
00:47:56,209 --> 00:47:57,293
You...

348
00:47:57,377 --> 00:47:59,963
Anybody seen any buns?

349
00:48:00,046 --> 00:48:02,841
Hmm. lrradiated.

350
00:48:05,552 --> 00:48:09,139
Don't take anything
that needs to be cooked, OK?

351
00:48:09,222 --> 00:48:11,057
I think you can eat that raw.

352
00:48:11,141 --> 00:48:13,018
Decaffeinated coffee...

353
00:48:13,101 --> 00:48:15,186
Put that back.

354
00:48:16,396 --> 00:48:18,648
Can'tjust take any crap.

355
00:48:18,732 --> 00:48:23,236
If I never see another chocolate bar again,
it'll be too soon.

356
00:48:23,653 --> 00:48:26,322
Not counting Terry's Chocolate Orange!

357
00:48:27,949 --> 00:48:31,578
Now, single malt,
16-year-old, dark, full flavour.

358
00:48:32,537 --> 00:48:34,497
Warm but not aggressive.

359
00:48:34,581 --> 00:48:38,084
- Peaty aftertaste.

360
00:48:39,669 --> 00:48:42,922
Takes out the fire but leaves in the warmth.

361
00:49:37,811 --> 00:49:40,897
Either we do this now or we're walking.

362
00:49:47,904 --> 00:49:49,989
Not you.

363
00:49:53,326 --> 00:49:55,620
- Stay close, Jim.
- What?

364
00:49:55,704 --> 00:49:57,789
You heard.

365
00:50:24,357 --> 00:50:26,443
Where are you going?

366
00:50:27,527 --> 00:50:29,946
We've got enough food, Jim.

367
00:50:30,030 --> 00:50:32,365
We don't have any cheeseburgers.

368
00:50:33,116 --> 00:50:35,785
Like going on holidays
with your aunt!

369
00:51:14,991 --> 00:51:17,452
Oh, Jesus.

370
00:51:43,269 --> 00:51:44,813
Hello?

371
00:51:58,618 --> 00:52:00,412
I hate you!

372
00:52:09,587 --> 00:52:11,673
Find anything?

373
00:52:13,925 --> 00:52:16,720
- Find anything, Jim?
- No! Let's get outta here.

374
00:52:16,803 --> 00:52:18,888
OK, we're done here.

375
00:52:21,099 --> 00:52:22,976
OK, Hannah.

376
00:52:30,358 --> 00:52:32,027
Easy. Brake!

377
00:52:32,110 --> 00:52:34,195
Brake, brake!

378
00:52:42,037 --> 00:52:44,122
Out.

379
00:53:28,708 --> 00:53:31,920
Mmmm! Oh my God!

380
00:53:32,671 --> 00:53:35,674
I can, like, taste the vitamin C.

381
00:53:36,508 --> 00:53:39,302
Mmmm, the raisins are so moist.

382
00:53:40,512 --> 00:53:42,597
What did you say?

383
00:53:42,681 --> 00:53:45,475
The raisins. They're so moist.

384
00:53:50,230 --> 00:53:52,315
Look over here.

385
00:54:03,618 --> 00:54:05,453
Like a family.

386
00:54:05,537 --> 00:54:07,997
Do you think they're infected?

387
00:54:08,415 --> 00:54:10,500
No.

388
00:54:13,962 --> 00:54:16,673
They're doing just fine.

389
00:54:22,429 --> 00:54:24,514
Come on. Let's eat!

390
00:54:39,195 --> 00:54:40,530
Know what I was thinking?

391
00:54:40,613 --> 00:54:44,325
That you'll never hear
another piece of original music again.

392
00:54:44,409 --> 00:54:48,580
You'll never read a book
that hasn't already been written,

393
00:54:49,622 --> 00:54:53,460
or see a film that hasn't already been shot.

394
00:54:57,964 --> 00:55:01,217
Um.... that's what you were thinking.

395
00:55:01,301 --> 00:55:03,178
No.

396
00:55:04,429 --> 00:55:06,723
I was thinking I was wrong.

397
00:55:07,974 --> 00:55:10,060
About what?

398
00:55:11,770 --> 00:55:13,855
All the death.

399
00:55:14,439 --> 00:55:16,524
All this shit.

400
00:55:18,151 --> 00:55:22,655
It doesn't really mean anything
to Frank and Hannah because...

401
00:55:24,032 --> 00:55:27,494
Well, she's got her dad
and he's got his daughter. So...

402
00:55:27,577 --> 00:55:29,704
Cheeky monkey!

403
00:55:30,163 --> 00:55:33,792
I was wrong when I said
staying alive is as good as it gets.

404
00:55:37,420 --> 00:55:39,923
See, that's what I was thinking.

405
00:55:40,423 --> 00:55:42,092
Was it?

406
00:55:42,175 --> 00:55:44,469
Mm. You stole my thought.

407
00:55:49,683 --> 00:55:51,559
Sorry.

408
00:55:52,519 --> 00:55:54,396
That's OK.

409
00:55:54,479 --> 00:55:56,564
You can keep it.

410
00:55:57,691 --> 00:56:01,695
It's getting late.
We'd better stay here for the night.

411
00:56:16,751 --> 00:56:19,295
I can't sleep.

412
00:56:19,379 --> 00:56:22,007
Me neither.

413
00:56:22,090 --> 00:56:24,467
Doesn't feel safe, does it?

414
00:56:24,551 --> 00:56:26,636
Outside like this.

415
00:56:27,512 --> 00:56:29,931
I think we're safe enough.

416
00:56:30,015 --> 00:56:32,684
Selena didn't seem to have any trouble.

417
00:56:33,393 --> 00:56:35,895
Yeah, I noticed that.

418
00:56:35,979 --> 00:56:37,480
Hey, Selena...

419
00:56:37,564 --> 00:56:39,649
What? What is it?

420
00:56:40,984 --> 00:56:43,028
How'd you get to sleep?

421
00:56:49,492 --> 00:56:53,371
Bloody hell. Must've needed
a hell of a prescription for that lot.

422
00:56:53,455 --> 00:56:57,751
I didn't need a prescription.
I qualified as a chemist.

423
00:56:57,834 --> 00:57:00,378
Oh, great. Valium.

424
00:57:00,462 --> 00:57:03,048
Not only will we be able to get to sleep

425
00:57:03,131 --> 00:57:06,843
but if we're attacked in the middle
of the night, we won't even care.

426
00:57:06,926 --> 00:57:09,179
- Two each.
- Not for me, thanks.

427
00:57:09,262 --> 00:57:11,306
Can I, Dad?

428
00:57:11,389 --> 00:57:13,391
I don't think so, sweetheart.

429
00:57:13,475 --> 00:57:14,976
Please?

430
00:57:16,478 --> 00:57:18,563
- No.
- I can't sleep.

431
00:57:21,649 --> 00:57:24,361
Come on, Frank. Let her live a little.

432
00:57:25,445 --> 00:57:29,449
- Give her half of one.
- All right. We're on.

433
00:57:40,126 --> 00:57:42,087
Night-night.

434
00:57:42,879 --> 00:57:45,507
You're a big softie, Frank.

435
00:58:16,121 --> 00:58:18,081
Frank?

436
00:58:18,164 --> 00:58:20,250
Hannah?

437
00:58:20,333 --> 00:58:22,210
Frank?

438
00:58:27,841 --> 00:58:29,926
Hello? Hello!

439
00:58:30,969 --> 00:58:32,220
Hello!

440
00:58:32,303 --> 00:58:34,806
Hello! Hello!

441
00:58:42,897 --> 00:58:44,983
Shh...

442
00:58:46,359 --> 00:58:49,154
You're having a bad dream, that's all.

443
00:58:51,906 --> 00:58:53,992
Thanks, Dad.

444
00:59:29,277 --> 00:59:31,863
Come on, sleepyhead.

445
00:59:35,533 --> 00:59:37,619
Come on, Babe Ruth.

446
00:59:40,830 --> 00:59:42,707
Hurry up.

447
00:59:44,459 --> 00:59:47,962
- Did I miss breakfast?
- You'll sleep through anything.

448
00:59:48,046 --> 00:59:53,051
- Did you have a fry-up?
- We'll stop at a pub on the way. Door!

449
01:00:17,617 --> 01:00:22,122
Our location
is the 42nd blockade, the M602,

450
01:00:22,205 --> 01:00:25,291
27 miles northeast of Manchester.

451
01:00:25,375 --> 01:00:27,293
You must find us. Please!

452
01:00:27,377 --> 01:00:29,504
Salvation is here.

453
01:00:29,587 --> 01:00:32,632
The answer to lnfection is here.

454
01:01:04,664 --> 01:01:06,750
Must be Manchester.

455
01:01:08,960 --> 01:01:12,339
The whole of Manchester, the whole city.

456
01:01:14,174 --> 01:01:16,509
No fire crews to put it out.

457
01:02:11,314 --> 01:02:13,900
42nd blockade.

458
01:02:13,983 --> 01:02:16,319
This is it.

459
01:03:27,474 --> 01:03:31,478
I don't understand, Dad.
Did they leave?

460
01:03:31,561 --> 01:03:34,689
- I don't like this. I think we should go.
- No!

461
01:03:41,529 --> 01:03:46,368
Vehicles. We should check the vehicles.
There has to be something.

462
01:04:04,511 --> 01:04:06,429
Nothing.

463
01:04:06,513 --> 01:04:08,431
I can't believe it.

464
01:04:08,515 --> 01:04:10,475
Frank...

465
01:04:10,934 --> 01:04:12,811
Frank!

466
01:04:15,021 --> 01:04:16,690
- We have to go.
- Yeah.

467
01:04:16,773 --> 01:04:19,275
Go fucking where?!

468
01:04:58,398 --> 01:05:00,567
Get out of it.

469
01:05:04,070 --> 01:05:06,156
Get out of it!

470
01:05:23,965 --> 01:05:26,551
Dad, are you all right?

471
01:05:26,634 --> 01:05:29,304
Yeah, I'm fine, sweetheart.

472
01:05:30,221 --> 01:05:32,932
Sorry I lost my temper.

473
01:05:33,016 --> 01:05:35,143
Hannah...

474
01:05:35,226 --> 01:05:38,188
I love you very much.

475
01:05:38,271 --> 01:05:40,273
- What?
- Keep away from me.

476
01:05:40,357 --> 01:05:42,692
Stay where you are.

477
01:05:42,776 --> 01:05:45,695
- Dad?
- Keep away from me! Keep away from me!

478
01:05:45,779 --> 01:05:48,281
Keep away! Keep away! Keep away!

479
01:05:48,365 --> 01:05:51,493
- Dad!
- Keep away! Keep away!

480
01:05:52,994 --> 01:05:55,747
What's wrong? Dad!

481
01:06:00,043 --> 01:06:02,462
Jim! Jim, he's infected!

482
01:06:02,545 --> 01:06:05,173
- No!
- Now, Jim! Now!

483
01:06:05,256 --> 01:06:08,677
- Jim, kill him! Jim!
- Dad!

484
01:06:08,760 --> 01:06:10,053
Kill him!

485
01:06:18,520 --> 01:06:20,814
Stay away from him!

486
01:06:22,065 --> 01:06:24,484
Keep away from the body!

487
01:06:27,237 --> 01:06:29,114
Dad?

488
01:06:51,511 --> 01:06:54,180
Three survivors. One male, two female.

489
01:06:54,264 --> 01:06:57,600
I repeat, one male, two female.

490
01:06:57,684 --> 01:07:00,270
ETA, 15.

491
01:07:00,353 --> 01:07:02,814
Put the kettle on.

492
01:07:50,779 --> 01:07:53,281
I'm Major Henry West.

493
01:07:54,532 --> 01:07:56,242
- Welcome.
- Jim.

494
01:07:56,326 --> 01:07:58,328
Hello, Jim.

495
01:07:58,411 --> 01:08:00,163
Hello.

496
01:08:02,415 --> 01:08:07,295
Well, we've got beds with clean sheets
and a boiler that produces hot water.

497
01:08:07,379 --> 01:08:09,798
So you can all have a shower.

498
01:08:09,881 --> 01:08:13,218
You look like you need one. Please.

499
01:08:33,154 --> 01:08:38,368
It ain't funny. I got loads of cooking to do,
you fucking Doris!

500
01:08:39,452 --> 01:08:41,579
Run him over!

501
01:08:44,290 --> 01:08:47,085
How is she doing?

502
01:08:47,168 --> 01:08:50,338
She's lost her dad, Jim. That's how she is.

503
01:08:53,008 --> 01:08:55,510
It's all fucked.

504
01:08:55,593 --> 01:08:57,595
What do you mean?

505
01:09:02,642 --> 01:09:06,229
Oh, don't do that.
Come on, come on, come on.

506
01:09:06,312 --> 01:09:08,398
Hey, don't do that.

507
01:09:10,066 --> 01:09:15,071
Hannah is what Frank says she is. Tough,
strong, and she'll cope just like I'll cope.

508
01:09:15,155 --> 01:09:19,075
- Just like you'll cope.
- I don't want her to have to fucking cope.

509
01:09:20,368 --> 01:09:22,787
I want her to be OK.

510
01:09:24,372 --> 01:09:26,541
When Hannah had her dad it was OK.

511
01:09:26,624 --> 01:09:29,419
It was OK for them and it was OK for us.

512
01:09:32,756 --> 01:09:35,175
Now it's all just fucked.

513
01:10:06,623 --> 01:10:09,459
So you heard our broadcast?

514
01:10:09,542 --> 01:10:13,046
- Yeah, we did.
- We must be a disappointment.

515
01:10:13,129 --> 01:10:19,260
You were hoping for a full brigade. An army
base with helicopters and a field hospital.

516
01:10:21,680 --> 01:10:25,850
- We were just hoping for...
- The answer to lnfection.

517
01:10:28,186 --> 01:10:30,271
Yeah.

518
01:10:30,355 --> 01:10:34,859
As I said before, it's here. Though
it may not be quite what you imagined.

519
01:10:35,235 --> 01:10:38,154
- Just feel lucky to have found you.
- You were lucky.

520
01:10:38,238 --> 01:10:41,366
The fire drove hundreds of lnfected
out of Manchester.

521
01:10:41,449 --> 01:10:44,536
The surrounding area's teeming with them.

522
01:10:46,287 --> 01:10:48,915

- Shh.

775
01:38:32,328 --> 01:38:34,414
Shh.

776
01:38:57,687 --> 01:38:59,773
Hannah?

777
01:39:47,487 --> 01:39:49,572
Hannah?

778
01:39:49,656 --> 01:39:51,157
Selena?

779
01:40:02,293 --> 01:40:06,673
I haven't got any bullets.
I haven't got any fucking bullets!

780
01:40:11,136 --> 01:40:13,805
Don't fucking leave me!

781
01:40:58,933 --> 01:41:00,685
Come on!

782
01:41:02,645 --> 01:41:04,689
Move!

783
01:41:04,773 --> 01:41:07,400

784

It's just you and me now, darlin'.
But don't worry, I'll get you out of here.

785
01:41:14,949 --> 01:41:19,412
Then we'll find a nice little fucking place
somewhere. Just you and me.

786
01:41:19,496 --> 01:41:21,831
And we'll live happy ever after, eh?

787

That was longer than a heartbeat.

788

Jim?

789
01:42:42,954 --> 01:42:46,499
Listen. Listen. It's not all fucked.

790
01:42:52,255 --> 01:42:54,758
We're gonna be OK. It's not all fucked.

791

- Shut up.

792
01:42:58,928 --> 01:43:01,222
It's gonna be OK.

793
01:43:06,686 --> 01:43:10,273
Hannah, it's OK! He's not infected.

794
01:43:10,357 --> 01:43:12,442
But I thought he was biting you.

795
01:43:12,525 --> 01:43:15,195
I was kissing her. Are you stoned?

796
01:43:15,278 --> 01:43:17,447
- It's a long story.{148592}{148643}We have to get out of here. Come on!

797
01:43:22,452 --> 01:43:24,537
Come on! Move!

798
01:43:31,544 --> 01:43:33,713
You killed all my boys.

799
01:43:33,797 --> 01:43:35,465
Wait...

800
01:43:42,847 --> 01:43:44,349
Hannah!

801
01:43:44,432 --> 01:43:46,059
Hannah? Hannah!

802
01:43:47,727 --> 01:43:49,938
Hannah!

803
01:44:06,079 --> 01:44:07,664
Get in.

804
01:44:26,641 --> 01:44:28,435
They're locked.

805
01:44:28,518 --> 01:44:30,937
The gates are locked!

806
01:44:33,565 --> 01:44:35,650
Fucking do it!

807
01:44:57,964 --> 01:45:00,383
Come on, Jim, breathe! Fucking breathe!

808
01:45:21,154 --> 01:45:23,448
Not the curtains as well.

809
01:46:34,102 --> 01:46:36,771
You looked all right in this, you know.

810
01:46:37,981 --> 01:46:39,482
It's coming!

811
01:46:56,166 --> 01:46:58,335
- You definitely heard it?
- Yeah!

812
01:46:58,418 --> 01:47:01,755
- I can't hear anything!
- I told you, I heard it!

813
01:47:22,233 --> 01:47:24,069
Go.

814
01:47:57,227 --> 01:48:00,146
Do you think he saw us this time?

815
01:52:57,235 --> 01:53:00,363
Visiontext subtitles: Susan Voas
